abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Second Tourism
            Development Project for the Ivory Coast was unsatisfactory.
            The project did not achieve many of its objectives,
            institutional development was negligible, sustainability is
            uncertain, and the performance of the Bank was
            unsatisfactory while the Borrower's was mixed. There
            are two main lessons that can be learned from this project.
            First, responsibility for administering a line of credit
            should only be given to a competent Borrower agency, or
            provision should be included in the project for a strong
            institutional building element to strengthen the agency.
            Second, the Bank should avoid financing projects in a sector
            that it plans to discontinue lending operations, unless it
            is prepared to make adequate provision for supervision.
